title: Jerry Scattini
text:
Jerrold Peter Scattini (born January 30, 1941) is an American former <a href="college%20football">college football</a> coach. He served as the head coach at the <a href="University%20of%20Nevada%2C%20Reno">University of Nevada, Reno</a> from 1969 to 1975. He amassed a 37–36–1 record during his tenure.
Scattini attended the <a href="University%20of%20California%2C%20Berkeley">University of California, Berkeley</a>, where he played on the <a href="California%20Golden%20Bears%20football">football team</a> from 1959 to 1961 as a <a href="halfback%20%28American%20football%29">halfback</a>. In 1960, "<a href="The%20Los%20Angeles%20Times">The Los Angeles Times</a>" characterized Scattini as California's best runner. That same season, "<a href="The%20Baltimore%20Sun">The Baltimore Sun</a>" noted that all three California halfbacks "are good-size but lack breakaway speed" and quoted coach <a href="Marv%20Levy">Marv Levy</a> as saying that the offense centered on the <a href="quarterback">quarterback</a>.
After college, the <a href="Green%20Bay%20Packers">Green Bay Packers</a> of the <a href="National%20Football%20League">National Football League</a> selected Scattini in the 19th round of the <a href="1962%20NFL%20Draft">1962 NFL Draft</a> as the 266th overall pick.
The <a href="University%20of%20Nevada%2C%20Reno">University of Nevada, Reno</a> hired Scattini as its head football coach, a position he held from 1969 to 1975. His teams compiled a 37–36–1 record. Scattini was fired in December 1975 after a 3–8 season and was replaced with <a href="UNLV%20Rebels%20football">UNLV</a> assistant <a href="Chris%20Ault">Chris Ault</a>. After football, Scattini entered business in <a href="finance">finance</a>.
